title: Bihu
hero_image_alt: Women performing Bihu dance in Assam
short_description: The soul of Assam, observing the harvest cycle with energetic Bihu dances, feasts, and community joy.
long_description:
Bihu is not one but a set of three festivals that mark the farming calendar in Assam. 

1. **Rongali Bihu (Bohag Bihu)** in April is the main one, marking the Assamese New Year and spring. It is famous for the sensuous and energetic Bihu dance where men and women dance to the rhythm of the Dhol and Pepa (horn).
2. **Kongali Bihu (Kati Bihu)** in October is solemn, marked by lighting lamps in paddy fields to pray for crop protection.
3. **Bhogali Bihu (Magh Bihu)** in January is the harvest festival of feasting, big bonfires (Meji), and community eating.

Rongali Bihu is the one for tourists—seven days of infectious energy, red and beige silk sarees (Muga Silk), and open-air concerts.
significance: Celebrates the agricultural cycle of Paddy.
key_rituals: Bihu Dance: Rapid hand movements and hip shaking.
Gamocha: Gifting the traditional red-white handwoven towel.
Pitha: Making rice cakes and sweets.
Cattle Worship: Bathing cows with turmeric on the first day.

practical_info.dress_tips: Cotton is best for April heat. Women can buy a Mekhela Chador as a souvenir.
practical_info.safety_tips: Safe. Assam tea gardens are beautiful but avoid wandering alone at night.

faqs.a: The key instruments are Dhol (drum), Pepa (buffalo horn), and Gogona (bamboo harp).
Assamese food is mild, favoring fermentation and herbs over heavy spices.
